name: vi_emergdept
comment_persistant: emergency department as per provider specialty for now not using this, using the one below

dispname: Readmission Within 30 Days of a Previous Discharge
name: vi_readm30
comment_persistant: True at first day of stay if previous discharge was 30 or fewer days before

name: vi_c_respiratory
comment_persistant: Vital status according to NAACCR, 0 = deceased, 1 = alive

name: vi_c_cns
comment_persistant: Not sure if RFV means suspected COVID-19 or confirmed

name: a_t0
comment_persistant: The first argument to the Surv() function. If there was a previous visit for that patient, must match the a_t1 for that visit, otherwise 0. Unit = days since randomly selected index visit.

name: a_t1
comment_persistant: The second argument to the Surv() function. If there was a subsequent visit for that patient, must match the a_t0 for that visit. Unit = days since randomly selected index visit.

name: z_subsample
comment_persistant: Each patient randomly assigned to either ‘devel’ or ‘test’

name: z_ipv
comment_persistant: Which inpatient stay is it for this patient? If ‘0’ then it’s a visit in the interval prior to their first inpatient stay. All visits have a number, but not all of them are part of an inpatient stay, it just means they fall in the interval between that inpatient stay and the next one.

name: z_inip
comment_persistant: Does this row of data represent a day that’s part of an inpatient stay?

name: z_age_at_disch_days
comment_persistant: Age at discharge (needed for readmission calc)
